Nomination: Aggregate zone
Notes: Single lookup that contains results from black, exploit and policy lists.
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: Lists individual IP addresses that have sent mail to spam traps.  And some manual added netblocks.
Nomination: Mostly Automatic with some manual additions.
Listing lifetime: For automated listings 5.6 days after last event, manual additions are permanent.
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: Lists IP addresses behaving in a way that indicates the IP is compromised, infected, proxy, VPN, TOR, malware,
Nomination: Automatic
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: Lists IP addresses that should not be connecting directly to MX, such as residential IPs etc.
Nomination: Automatic
Notes: Lists ranges that have generic or templated rDNS.  Individual IPs can be delisted immediately via web.
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: Lists domains seen in spam hitting traps.
Nomination: Automatic
Notes: Can be used as an RHSBL and a URIBL.
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: Lists domains that are newly observed (first use)
Nomination: Automatic
Notes: Based on historical passive DNS data, lists domains first seen in the wild within the last 25 hours).
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: Lists short URLs (SHA-1 hashed) seen in traps.
Nomination: Automatic
Notes: Created to handle popular shorteners that are misused to hide domains from blacklisting.
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: Lists URLs of online drive services (SHA-1 hashed) seen in traps.
Nomination: Automatic
Notes: Current only listing Google Drive and Yandex Disk URLs that are used to avoid domain blacklisting.
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: Lists IP ranges belonging to officially published abuse addresses that either bounce or request not to receive abuse notices. The aim of this list is to block companies that openly shrug their abuse responsibilities.
Nomination: Abuse addresses that fail to be deliverable for 3 out of the last 7 days are automatically added.
Listing lifetime: Lifetime listing or automatic once mail delivery resumes in the case of automated additions.
Notes: Domain expired in early 2020
Collateral listings: yes

Listing goal: Lists IP ranges belonging to abuse addresses that have failed to handle abuse issues for at least 30 days. The aim of this list is to hold companies accountable for the abuse that originates from their networks rather than just ignoring it.
Nomination: IP ranges belonging to abuse addresses with reported and unresolved issues for at least 30 days are automatically added.
Listing lifetime: Automatic removal is done once all hosts with abuse unresolved for 30 days have been clean for 2 weeks.
Notes: Data for lists are generated from live data collected by the WebIron web security platform. Domain expired in early 2020
Collateral listings: yes

Listing goal: Lists single IP addresses recently attacking websites and servers.
Nomination: Lists IP addressed belonging to hosts that have attacked at least twice within the last 48 hours.
Listing lifetime: Automatic removal is done once a host has gone 24 hours without an incident
Notes: Data for lists are generated from live data collected by the WebIron web security platform. Domain expired in early 2020
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: Contains IP addresses and ranges from BABL, CABL, and STABL
Nomination: Depends on list
Notes: Domain expired in early 2020
Collateral listings: yes

Listing goal: Web Crawler IP lookup used to match user agents with known crawler IP addresses. Data from this list is considered BETA.
Notes: This DNSRBL contains valid and legitimate crawlers. Matching alone should not be used for blocking Domain expired in early 2020
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: Extremely conservative list of single IP4 addresses that produce exclusively spam/malware as indicated by the GBUdb IP Reputation system. Most systems should be able to safely reject connections based on this list.
Nomination: Automatic: IPs are added when the GBUdb "cloud" statistics reach a probability figure that indicates 95% of messages produce a spam/malware pattern match and a confidence figure that indicates sufficient data to trust the probability data.
Listing lifetime: Automatic: Continuous while reputation statistics remain bad. Warning: Produces false positives, and has no remedy/removal process. IPs are dropped quickly if the statistics improve (within an hour). IPs are dropped within 36 hours (typ) if no more messages are seen (dead zombie).
Notes: Source data is derived from a global network of Message Sniffer filtering nodes in real-time. Truncate data is updated from statistics every 10 minutes.  Warning: Unreliable, as it produces false positives. It is impossible to find additional information or to manually troubleshoot the problem. It is based on results created by their proprietary software running a proprietary algorithm.
Collateral listings: no

Nomination: Single IP addresses which only send UBE. Specializing in snowshoe spam and other under the radar spams which evade many other DNSBLs. Has FP-level comparable to Zen.
Listing lifetime: Automatic (upon receipt of a spam to a real persons mailbox), with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives
Notes: Typically an automatic expiration 11 days after the last abuse was seen, but with some exceptions
Collateral listings: Spam samples are always kept on file for each listing. Removal requests are manually reviewed and processed without fees.

Nomination: Lists /24 blocks of IP addresses which usually only send UBE and containing at least several addresses which are confirmed emitters of junk mail. Collateral listings are kept to a minimum because subsections are often carved from /24 listings when spammers and legit senders share the same /24 block.
Listing lifetime: Automatic once at least several IP addresses from a given block are individually listed on ivmSIP, with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives
Notes: Expiration time increases to many weeks as the fraction of IP addresses in the /24 block in question sending junk mail increases
Collateral listings: Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees.

Nomination: Comparable to uribl.com and surbl.org, this is a list of IP addresses and domains which are used by spammers in the clickable links found in the body of spam messages
Listing lifetime: Automatic (upon receipt of a spam to a real persons mailbox), with extensive whitelists and filtering to prevent false positives
Notes: Typically an automatic expiration several weeks after the last abuse was seen.
Collateral listings: Spam samples are always kept on file for each listing. Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees.

Nomination: Lists all types of open (publicly accessible) proxies
Listing lifetime: Automated listing through crawling of websites
Notes: As long as proxy is verified open (automated) Service discontinued mid 2014
Collateral listings: Time between verifications increases exponentially in relation to the number of times the host was verified an open proxy

Nomination: Single IP addresses that send mail to spamtraps
Listing lifetime: Automatic by a cluster of more than 60 trapservers
Notes: Automatic expiration 7 days after the last abuse was seen, optionally express delisting for a small fee.
Collateral listings: UCEPROTECTs primary and the only independent list

Nomination: Allocations with exceeded UCEPROTECT Level 1 listings
Notes: Automatic removal as soon as Level 1 listings decrease below Level 2 listing border, optionally express delisting (for a fee)
Collateral listings: Fully depending on Level 1

Nomination: ASNs with excessive UCEPROTECT Level 1 listings
Notes: Automatic removal as soon as Level 1 listings decrease below Level 3 listing border, optionally express delisting (fee)
Collateral listings: Fully depending on Level 1

DNS blacklist: Spam and Open Relay Blocking System (SORBS)
Nomination: Unsolicited bulk/commercial email senders
Notes: N/A (See individual zones)
Collateral listings: Aggregate zone (all aggregates and what they include are listed on SORBS)

Nomination: Unsolicited bulk/commercial email senders
Notes: N/A (See individual zones)
Collateral listings: "Safe" Aggregate zone (all zones in dnsbl.sorbs.net except "recent", "old", "spam" and "escalations")

Nomination: Open HTTP proxy servers
Notes: Until delisting requested.

Nomination: Open SOCKS proxy servers
Notes: Until delisting requested.

Nomination: Additional proxy servers
Notes: Until delisting requested.
Collateral listings: Those not already listed in the HTTP or SOCKS databases

Nomination: Open SMTP relay servers
Notes: Until delisting requested.

Nomination: IP addresses with vulnerabilities that are exploitable by spammers (e.g. FormMail scripts)
Notes: Until delisting requested or Automated Expiry

Nomination: Hosts that have sent spam to the admins of SORBS or SORBS Spamtraps in the last 48 hours
Notes: Renewed every 20 minutes based inclusion in on spam.dnsbl.sorbs.net

Nomination: Hosts that have sent spam to the admins of SORBS or SORBS Spamtraps in the last 28 days
Notes: Renewed every 20 minutes based inclusion in on spam.dnsbl.sorbs.net

Nomination: Hosts that have sent spam to the admins of SORBS or SORBS Spamtraps in the last year
Notes: Renewed every 20 minutes based inclusion in on spam.dnsbl.sorbs.net

Nomination: Hosts that have allegedly sent spam to the admins of SORBS or SORBS Spamtraps at any time
Notes: Until delisting requested.

Nomination: Netblocks of service providers believed to support spammers
Notes: Until delisting requested and matter resolved.
Collateral listings: Service providers are added on receipt of a third strike spam

Nomination: Hosts demanding that they never be tested
Notes: N/A

Nomination: Hijacked networks
Notes: Until delisting requested.

Nomination: Dynamic IP address ranges
Notes: Until delisting requested.
Collateral listings: Not a list of dial-up IP addresses

Nomination: No Servers Permitted by ISP Policy
Notes: Not Applicable.
Collateral listings: No Servers Permitted by ISP Policy

Nomination: Aggregate RHS zones
Notes: N/A

Nomination: Domains with invalid A or MX records in DNS
Listing lifetime: Open submission via automated testing page.
Notes: Until delisting requested.

Nomination: Domains which the owners have confirmed will not be used for sending email
Notes: Until delisting requested.

Nomination: This list contains IP addresses that are observed to be involved in sending spam, snowshoe spamming, botnet command and controllers (C ;Cs), bulletproof hosting companies and hijacked IP space.
Notes: From five minutes to a year or more, depending on issue and resolution

Listing goal: This lists the individual IPs (/32s) that are infected with malware, worms, and Trojans; third party exploits, such as open proxies; or devices controlled by botnets. The constantly updated list is designed to protect networks from malware and spam by preventing mailservers  from accepting connections from compromised computing devices.
Nomination: Third-party with automated additions
Listing lifetime: Varies, under a month, self removal via Composite Blocking List lookup.
Notes: Consists of the Composite Blocking List
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: This list is a real-time database of raw and filtered feeds that provides additional information on hijacked IP addresses. The eXBL is available to selected security organizations and cyber incident response teams.
Nomination: Third-party with automated additions
Listing lifetime: Varies, under a month, self removal via Composite Blocking List lookup.
Notes: Consists of the Composite Blocking List
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: Domains owned by spammers and used for spam or other malicious purposes. This blocklist also contains domains owned by non-spammers which are used for legitimate purposes, but have been hijacked by spammers.
Nomination: Ranking of over 80 different metrics and machine learning
Listing lifetime: A few days. Self-removal  generally allowed.

Listing goal: This list provides detailed information on each domain listing and is available via an API. This enables you to query the DBL engine
Nomination: returning a JSON record for each domain that you are investigating.

Blacklist operator: The Enhanced Domain Blocklist (eDBL) helps you to track a particular domains score over a longer period, or combine Domain Blocklist data with information from your own threat intelligence platform.
A few days. Self-removal  generally allowed.

Listing goal: This list includes IP address ranges for end-user devices, such as home routers, smart TVs, and other Information of Things (IoT) devices, from which email should never be sent.  This protects networks from the potential of being compromised by malware spread by botnet command and controller servers (C ;Cs).
Nomination: Manual, by providers controlling the IPs or by Spamhaus PBL Team
Notes: Should not be confused with the MAPS DUL and Wirehub Dynablocker lists
Collateral listings: no

Listing goal: This list contains the following content areas: Cryptowallet (Bitcoin etc.)
Nomination: Malware and Email addresses.

Blacklist operator: Hash Blocklists (HBL) are lists of cryptographic hashes associated with malicious content, as opposed to IP addresses or domains. They are extremely useful for filtering fraudulent emails coming from ISPs, domains, or IP addresses that Spamhaus is unable to list e.g. Gmail. Additionally, they can block emails containing malware files.
DNS blacklist: Manual, by providers controlling the IPs or by Spamhaus PBL Team
Nomination: no

Zone: This lists newly registered domains for 24 hours. Domains that have just been registered are rarely used by legitimate organizations immediately. Cybercriminals register and burn 100s of domains daily.

Blacklist operator: The Zero Reputation Domain (ZRD) blocklist helps to protect your users from clicking on links and visiting newly registered domains until it is established that they are not associated with zero day attacks; phishing, bot-herding, spyware and ransomware campaigns.
Nomination: no

Zone: A single lookup for querying the SBL, XBL and PBL databases.
Listing lifetime: Preferred list to check all Spamhaus listings with one query.
Notes: As per component list
Collateral listings: As per component list

Nomination: Unsolicited bulk/Commercial email senders (/24 IP address block)
Notes: Until delisting requested? (Only when found to not be a spam source)Their web server is down 2014-11-17 - Their RBL server is reporting all queries as SPAM.
Collateral listings: Aggregate zone

Listing goal: cbl.abuseat.org (also free available rsync access, on request see FAQ )
Nomination: Only IP addresses exhibiting characteristics specific to open proxies, spamware, malware downloaders, botnets and the like.
Listing lifetime: Automatic: large spamtraps, production mail servers and other detection methods.
Notes: Less than a month after last listable event, self-removal via CBL lookup.
Collateral listings: Use Spamhaus XBL or Spamhaus Zen instead; they include CBL.
This DNSBL zone is part of the default configuration for Proventia Mail Security System and Lotus Protector for Mail Security

Nomination: IP addresses used to send spam to trap
Notes: Temporary, until spam stops

Nomination: IP addresses used to send spam to trap
Notes: Temporary, until spam stops

Nomination: IP addresses used to send UBE to members
Notes: Temporary, until spam stops

Nomination: IP Reputation based. Seems to be proprietary.
Notes: Temporary. Has self removal, users can not request delisting.
Collateral listings: Accused by Spamhaus of unauthorized and undisclosed listings reuse.

Nomination: IP addresses which have been used to transmit reported email to SpamCop users
Notes: Temporary, until spam stops, has self removal

Nomination: IP addresses detected as abusive at ISPs using MagicMail Servers, with no reverse DNS service
Notes: Listed until removed, and reverse DNS configured

Nomination: IP addresses detected as abusive at ISPs using MagicMail Servers, with non-conforming reverse DNS service (See Best Practises) indicative of compromised systems
Notes: Listed until removed, and reverse DNS set to conform to Best Practises

Nomination: IP addresses detected as abusive at ISPs using MagicMail Servers, and manually confirmed as spam sources
Notes: Listed until removed

Nomination: IP addresses detected probing passwords or authenticating without sending mail
Notes: Listed until removed

Listing goal: IP addresses and related generic netblocks that have sent spam.
Nomination: spamtraps
Listing lifetime: Until removal requested and matter resolved by changing server DNS ptr record to a non-generic name.
Notes: Even if a particular IP has not sent spam, it may be included in a generic netblock which will provide many false positives. listed=127.0.0.2 Offline since 2018-05-30.
Collateral listings: Yes

Nomination: IP addresses used to send spam to traps or members
Notes: Varies from spam type, rate and other sophisticated factors. 30 s to 1 week.
Collateral listings: High IP network aggregate threshold greater than or equal 254. Offline since 2010.

Nomination: Detects viruses by behavior using fake high MX and tracking non-use of QUIT
Notes: Black list Data lives for 4 days. White list data lives for 10 days.

Nomination: Aggregate zone, contains UCE/bulk email senders, open proxies, open relays, trojaned/infected machines, comment/trackback spammers
Notes: Until delisting requested As announced, all public zones are no longer functioning (they return positive responses for all queries)
Collateral listings: Aggregate zone (all aggregates and what they include are listed on AHBL)

Nomination: Domains sending spam, domains owned by spammers, comment spam domains, spammed URLs
Subset of dnsbl, contains only open proxies, compromised machines, comment spammers
Collateral listings: Designed for use on IRC servers

Nomination: Stop spam from hosts that send no legitimate mail (list most non-mail-sending hosts).
Listing lifetime: Listings based on "instant" automated checks, recipient nomination and traps.
Notes: Listings can be challenged.  Subscribers vote to decide sender status.
Collateral listings: Public list follows standard dnsbl protocol.  Subscription based service is more capable, but does not follow standard.

DNS blacklist: Heise Zeitschriften Verlag GmbH  ; Co. KG, hosted by manitu GmbH
Nomination: Lists single IPs (no IP ranges) that send spam to spamtraps. Lists mailhosts, rather than domains, and thus blocks entire hosting providers and ISPs.
Listing lifetime: Automated listing due to spamtrap hits. Exceptions apply to bounces, NDRs and whitelisted IPs.
Notes: 12 hours after last listing or until self delisting
Collateral listings: TXT records provide information of listing incident - NiX Spam also provides hashes for fuzzy checksum plugin (iXhash) for SpamAssassin.

Nomination: Single IP addresses
Listing lifetime: IP addresses can be reported as known spam sources by users, additionally automated listing if spam arrives at the mailservers of inps.de
Notes: IP addresses are listed until they are removed manually via the website.
Collateral listings: A- and TXT records are available for each entry; Removal is free after 30 days for automatic additions and after 7 days for manual additions; otherwise removal fee is at least EUR 10,00.  Site Deactivated by sponsor Christian Jung per http://inps.de/  as seen 2020-05-25

Nomination: IP-Addresses who Attacks other Server/Honeypots over ssh, imap, smtp, ftp, web, rfi, sqli, ddos....
Listing lifetime: Automatic: over Honeypots and with over 515 Users and 630 Servers from blocklist.de via Fail2Ban or own scripts
Notes: Automatic: 48 Hours after the last Attack. But earlier remove is available over the Delist-Link
Collateral listings: Services are free. Source data is from Honeypot-Systems and over 515 User with 630 Servern there reports Attacks with Fail2Ban

Nomination: Spam sources, relay abusers
Notes: Automatic expiry (varies by type); webpage allows delisting
Collateral listings: Removal requests are quickly and manually reviewed and processed without fees.

Nomination: Spam sources from email, forums, referrer spam and dictionary attacks
Notes: Twelve months unless ISPs request removal earlier
Collateral listings: By request. ISPs can provide request exclusion.

Nomination: IP addresses used to send spam to traps
Listing lifetime: spamtraps, in order to avoid abusive reports (Competitors, false positive, etc...) only MegaRBL team can add an IP to the list.
Notes: Until delisting requested, which is impossible.
Collateral listings: Removal requests are impossible, since the necessary login after registration fails every time. So without possibility to log in there is really no way to place a removal request. Once listed on MegaRBL an IP stays there forever. Maybe preparation for upcoming business model to earn much money with a removal service. Should not be considered a serious source for blacklist info. Domain expired in November, 2019 and service is discontinued.

Nomination: Spam Trap
Listing lifetime: List of IP addresses that sends spam or causing troubles with botnets or phishing
Notes: Until delisting requested.
Collateral listings: Removal requests will be investigated and processed within 24 hours of submission.Previously known as IPrange.net RBL Project

Nomination: Collection of Bad Actors from various sources, Works great with PiHole for personal use.
Listing lifetime: Spammers, Scammers, Malware, Cryptominers, TOR, botnets, phishing, attackers, harvesters, exfiltration etc. Basically anything and everything "bad"
Notes: Until delisting requested.
Collateral listings: Removal requests will be investigated. Contact details provided.

Nomination: Spam Trap
Listing lifetime: Provides a list of IP addresses which are sending spam. The Barracuda Reputation system uses automated collection methods to add and delete IP addresses from the BRBL.
Notes: Until delisting requested.
Collateral listings: Requires registration of administrator and hosts to use. Removal requests are typically investigated and processed within 12 hours of submission if provided with a valid explanation.

Nomination: Bad reputation, difficult to identify the responsible, dynamic IP, SLAAC flag without genuine email service and inappropriate use of the URL
Listing lifetime: Provides a list of IPv4/IPv6 addresses and domains which are sending spam or phishing.
Notes: Until delisting requested or seven days with good reputation.
Collateral listings: The feedback system runs at SMTP layer. See https://spfbl.net/en/feedback

Nomination: IP addresses that recently sent viruses.
Listing lifetime: 2 virus mails sent to an associated system.
Notes: Automatic delisting. Listed as long as there were more than 2 virus mails sent in the last week. Offline Since May 2016

Listing goal: IP addresses which have sent email to addresses harvested from suppression (opt-out) files
Nomination: Traps
Listing lifetime: For 30 days after last offending message unless removal is requested
Collateral listings: No

Listing goal: IP addresses detected as unsolicited bulk/commercial email senders, webspam
Nomination: Manual
Notes: Removal requests are manually reviewed and processed without fees.
Collateral listings: Rarely (escalation)

Nomination: Unsolicited bulk/commercial email senders, webspam
Notes: Until delisting requested.
Collateral listings: Removal requests are manually reviewed and processed without fees.

Nomination: A single IP(127.0.0.#) is listed upon sending spam to a spam trap, sending from multiple IPs within a range within a short period of time will result in a class C listing(127.0.#.0).
Listing lifetime: Until an IP owner/authorized admin requests listing removal.
Notes: Single IP Listed with Data result 127.0.0.# Class C IP Block Listed with Data result 127.0.#.0 Codes are as follows: (ie. General spam single IP result 127.0.0.1)  # general spam, Sending spam to our spam traps. # Removal request made but missing required information, please make a new request and be sure to complete the form properly. # Does not follow valid can-spam rules for newsletters / lists.  # Not RFC compliant, server errors or improper configuration.  # Repeat offenders, these are IPs that have been removed and listed again (3) or more times in a short period of time. # Bouncing email to the wrong server, RFC-non-compliant configurations.  # Relay or Open relay with reports of spam. # bouncing spoofed emails, you need to disable bounce of spoofed emails in order to get de listed. # Fraud/Scam emails, malware or illegal/abusive content.
Collateral listings: No

Listing goal: IPs and domains for junk mail filtering (aggregate zone).
Nomination: Mostly automatic with some manual additions.
Collateral listings: yes
